metaData.descriptionCS: For Digit Span Forward, the child repeats numbers in the same order as read aloud by the examiner. For Digit Span Backward, the child repeats numbers in the reverse order of that presented aloud by the examiner.

consecutiveZerosDiscontinueRule.description: This subtest discontinues after scores of 0 on both trials of an item.

trials.correctInstructionsHTML:
Correct response:

Say, That’s right.

Introduce Trial 2:

Say, Let’s try these numbers.  Remember, you are to say them backward: 5 - 6.
trials.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect response:

Say, That’s not quite right. I said 8 - 2, so to say it backward, you should say 2 - 8.

Let’s try again: 8 - 2.

[For second attempt]  

Correct response: Say, That’s right.

Incorrect response: Say, That’s not quite right. I said 8 - 2, so to say it backward, you should say 2 - 8.

Introduce Trial 2:

Say, Let’s try these numbers.  Remember, you are to say them backward: 5 - 6.
trials.title: Backward Sample Item Trial 1

trials.incorrectInstructionsHTML:
Incorrect response:

Say, That’s not quite right. I said 5 - 6, so to say it backward, you should say 6 - 5.

Let’s try again: 5 - 6.

[For second attempt]  

Correct response: Say, That's right.

Incorrect response: Say, That’s not quite right. I said 5 - 6, so to say it backward, you should say 6 - 5.
trials.title: Backward Sample Item Trial 2

consecutiveZerosDiscontinueRule.description: This subtest discontinues after scores of 0 on both trials of an item.
